snippet.title: GEOMETRY NODES LANDED! üöÄ Blender Today
snippet.description:
Finally as part of the main Blender development branch, the new Geometry Nodes editor is available for everyone to play. Keep in mind this is still under heavy development, but considered stable enough for public experimental use.

* Blog post: https://code.blender.org/2020/12/everything-nodes-and-the-scattered-stone/
* Documentation: https://docs.blender.org/manual/en/dev/modeling/modifiers/nodes/index.html

Support Blender development: https://fund.blender.org

Download Blender Experimental builds: https://blender.org/experimental

snippet.title: TEXT & CURVES with CUSTOM BEVELS! ‚ú® Blender Today
snippet.description:
Even though curve objects could already use other curves as bevel profiles, this new feature makes it much simpler in cases when you just want a specific shape or you don't need to animate it, all without having to carry an extra object around. Plus it uses the same system as meshes, yay for consistency! 

Make Blender better at https://fund.blender.org

snippet.description:
Fluid simulation caches can now be imported/exported in OpenVDB! This will be part of the upcoming Blender 2.90 so go and test it out at https://blender.org/experimental !

snippet.title: CPU DENOISE IN THE VIEWPORT! | Blender Today
snippet.description:
Cycles CPU users rejoice! Fast denoising is here! OpenImageDenoise is now available in the viewport, making your renders look buttery smooth in seconds. This will be part of the upcoming Blender 2.90 release but as always you can already try it out in the experimental builds: https://builder.blender.org/download/

Robot from the Blender 2.81 splash artwork by Alex Trevi√±o - https://cloud.blender.org/p/gallery/5dd6d7044441651fa3decb56

snippet.description:
Another long-awaited feature by modelers! Plus snap to Lights and Cameras, and Bevel now gets absolute amount option and custom curve profile gets little widgets. It will be part of the upcoming Blender 2.90 release but as always you can already try it out in the experimental builds: https://builder.blender.org/download/

snippet.title: BLENDER 2.90 RECAP EARLY JUNE üöÄ Blender Today
snippet.description:
These changes are possible thanks to the Blender Development Fund.
Help Blender development by joining for only $6 per month: https://fund.blender.org

Blender.Today LIVE is a show hosted by Pablo Vazquez highlighting the latest news on Blender, the community, and answering all your questions.

Watch more RECAPs: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLa1F2ddGya_9jNuboY4w2IUcgoFJxdkKH

Changes:
* Add Primitive Tool:
* Drag & Drop Modifiers
* Improved Area Border Selection and Dragging
* UI: Pan 2D Region When Dragging to Boundary
* Curves: Implement Handles for selected points only (Overlay)
* Curves: Disable Curve Normals by default
* Preferences: Customize default empty size for collection instances
* UI: undo/redo support for text fields
* UI: Curve Edit Stroke Panel Layout
* UI: Windows Shell Links & Improved Mac Aliases
* UI: rename Cycles point light Size to Radius, for consistency and clarity
* VSE UI: Add buttons for swap Effect strip inputs
* VSE UI: Rename Scene Strip panel and move View panel on top
* VSE UI: Group Show Elements in View Menu, Use Consistent Naming
* VSE: Add warnings for failed proxy encoding
* VSE: Add select under playhead, and shortcuts for left, right, under.
* VSE: Remove delete confirmation pop-up
* VSE: Use color picker for color strip.
* VSE UI: Add a proxy menu to Preview/View menu
* VSE UI: Text panel adjustments
* Eyedropper: Support get samples from other windows
* Gizmo Library: New Snap Gizmo
* Sculpt: Cloth Filter
* Sculpt: Pose Brush Scale/Transform deform mode
* Sculpt: Pose Brush Face Sets FK mode
* Sculpt: Improve twist axis in Pose FK mode
* LibOverride: Make constraints fully overrideable.
* LibOverride: Make camera data-block properties overrideable.
* LibOverride: Make all modifiers properties overridable.
* Modifiers: Add normalize weights option to vertex weight modifiers
* EEVEE: Refactor of eevee_material.c
* Fluid: Foundation for new OpenVDB file IO
* Annotations: Add Stabilization for draw tool
* GPencil: New Percentage parameter in Build modifier
* UV: use selection for 'Seams from Islands'
* Armature: increase maximum delectable bones from 4096 to 8192
* Cycles: Enable OptiX on all Maxwell+ GPUs
* Cycles: Added shadow terminator offset parameter.
* Cycles: change perspective depth pass to be more standard
* OpenSubdiv Refactor
* BVHCache: Performance
* DrawManager: Graph Task Scheduling
* Mesh: skip conversion from edit-mesh to mesh in edit-mode
* FBX: Make importing heavy animations twice more quicker.
* New Release Versioning

--

BlenderToday Links:
* Chat: https://blender.chat/channel/today
* Community: http://blender.today
* Twitter: https://twitter.com/BlenderToday
* YouTube - https://www.youtube.com/BlenderCommunity

--

Pablo Vazquez Links: 
* Instagram - https://instagram.com/pablovazquez.art
* Twitter - https://twitter.com/pablovazquez_
* YouTube - https://www.youtube.com/PabloVazquez
* ArtStation - https://artstation.com/pablovazquez

Background music by Thaehan https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC5HYJTpconGuwC8g-l1QXLg

#BlenderToday #b3d

snippet.description:

Help Blender development by joining for only $6 per month: https://fund.blender.org

Blender.Today LIVE is a show hosted by Pablo Vazquez highlighting the latest news on Blender, the community, and answering all your questions.

Watch more RECAPs: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLa1F2ddGya_9jNuboY4w2IUcgoFJxdkKH

Changes:
* Add Primitive Tool:
* Drag & Drop Modifiers
* Improved Area Border Selection and Dragging
* UI: Pan 2D Region When Dragging to Boundary
* Curves: Implement Handles for selected points only (Overlay)
* Curves: Disable Curve Normals by default
* Preferences: Customize default empty size for collection instances
* UI: undo/redo support for text fields
* UI: Curve Edit Stroke Panel Layout
* UI: Windows Shell Links & Improved Mac Aliases
* UI: rename Cycles point light Size to Radius, for consistency and clarity
* VSE UI: Add buttons for swap Effect strip inputs
* VSE UI: Rename Scene Strip panel and move View panel on top
* VSE UI: Group Show Elements in View Menu, Use Consistent Naming
* VSE: Add warnings for failed proxy encoding
* VSE: Add select under playhead, and shortcuts for left, right, under.
* VSE: Remove delete confirmation pop-up
* VSE: Use color picker for color strip.
* VSE UI: Add a proxy menu to Preview/View menu
* VSE UI: Text panel adjustments
* Eyedropper: Support get samples from other windows
* Gizmo Library: New Snap Gizmo
* Sculpt: Cloth Filter
* Sculpt: Pose Brush Scale/Transform deform mode
* Sculpt: Pose Brush Face Sets FK mode
* Sculpt: Improve twist axis in Pose FK mode
* LibOverride: Make constraints fully overrideable.
* LibOverride: Make camera data-block properties overrideable.
* LibOverride: Make all modifiers properties overridable.
* Modifiers: Add normalize weights option to vertex weight modifiers
* EEVEE: Refactor of eevee_material.c
* Fluid: Foundation for new OpenVDB file IO
* Annotations: Add Stabilization for draw tool
* GPencil: New Percentage parameter in Build modifier
* UV: use selection for 'Seams from Islands'
* Armature: increase maximum delectable bones from 4096 to 8192
* Cycles: Enable OptiX on all Maxwell+ GPUs
* Cycles: Added shadow terminator offset parameter.
* Cycles: change perspective depth pass to be more standard
* OpenSubdiv Refactor
* BVHCache: Performance
* DrawManager: Graph Task Scheduling
* Mesh: skip conversion from edit-mesh to mesh in edit-mode
* FBX: Make importing heavy animations twice more quicker.
* New Release Versioning

--

snippet.title: MULTIRES IN BLENDER 2.90 ü§Ø Blender Today RECAP 101
snippet.description:
All these changes are possible thanks to the Blender Development Fund. Join! https://fund.blender.org

Blender.Today LIVE is a show hosted by Pablo Vazquez highlighting the latest news on Blender, the community, and answering all your questions.

Watch more RECAPs: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLa1F2ddGya_9jNuboY4w2IUcgoFJxdkKH

Changes:
* UI: Stats in Viewport https://developer.blender.org/D7534
* UI: Default: Viewport Clip https://developer.blender.org/rB246d59ff0ff2b4848d9b3b57e5c01dde3f2246e3
* UI: Default: Track Constraints https://developer.blender.org/rBbe009020827c99d898a2f816605a782491ddb7f0
* UI: Show operators in search menu https://developer.blender.org/rB7163e159c54524a34ca4bc96d37cd778d7b19822
* UI: Use decorators in material props https://developer.blender.org/rB4cc8123377b1502e028a8f9e6132b78e46e0520f
* GPencil: Add material selector to context menus https://developer.blender.org/rB6a7e9f2b7647fb1883fc77f72c3d411c0a692cf7
* Multires: Enable sculpting in all subdivision levels https://developer.blender.org/D7575
* Multires: Unsubdivide and Rebuild Subdivisions https://developer.blender.org/D7372
* Multires: Subdivide Simple and Subdivide Linear https://developer.blender.org/D7415
* Tracking: Implement Nuke/Natron distortion model https://developer.blender.org/rBb7bcd0a87c9df2f11d7249c64768e9526b2048bd
* Task: Use TBB as Task Scheduler https://developer.blender.org/rBd8a3f3595af0fb3ca5937e41c2728fd750d986ef
* Node Wrangler: support emission viewer inside node groups https://developer.blender.org/D6956
* GHOST: initial Wayland support https://developer.blender.org/rB66e70fe299e15124d9250a6a24e591cbb733713a
* Fix T76097: Simulations don't take animated gravity into account https://developer.blender.org/rB31d3f034ab8b7531eded7b0200d6ec77ba29b6a2

--

snippet.title: BLENDER 2.90 ALPHA! - Blender Today RECAP #098+99
snippet.description:
Who said Blender 2.83 was closed for new features? Two new sculpt features made it in! Then it's all about 2.90 with user interface improvements, a bunch of modeling and solidify modifier news that will make a looot of people happy, plus Grease Pencil and even VSE updates.

- How to Report a Bug: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JTD0OJq_rF4

snippet.title: SCULPT GALORE, EEVEE HAIR and more! | Blender Today RECAP #097
snippet.description:
What a way for 2.83 to jump into BETA! Crazy stuff this week. EEVEE hair got alpha hash transparency support, Cycles is faster on AMD graphics cards, Sculpt and Face Sets got major improvements, even the Video Sequence Editor and NLA! If that wasn't enough, Blender 2.90 entered ALPHA stage.

Note: Had a bunch of technical issues this week, apologies for the delay.

snippet.title: Blender VR, OPENVDB VOLUME, VSE | Blender Today RECAP #096
snippet.description:
What a way to jump into bcon2 stage! Don't know what bcon1,2,3 is? No, it's not a beacon, nor bacon, neither BConf that's something else, yes it is confusing. Watch to learn what bcon means in the Blenderverse, plus all the goodies like VR, OpenVDB Volume object type, Disk Cache in Video Sequencer, and much more!
